globalShortcuts.name: Business App Studio (BAS)
globalShortcuts.notes: Cloud IDE. Remember to start your Dev Space!

notes.content:
BTP Region and Datacenter Mapping:

**Americas:**
‚Ä¢ US East (VA) = us10 (AWS)
‚Ä¢ US East (VA) Gov = us30 (AWS GovCloud)
‚Ä¢ Canada = ca10 (Azure)
‚Ä¢ Brazil = br10 (AWS)

**Europe:**
‚Ä¢ Europe (Frankfurt) = eu10 (AWS)
‚Ä¢ Europe (Netherlands) = eu20 (Azure)
‚Ä¢ Europe (Frankfurt) = eu30 (AWS)
‚Ä¢ Switzerland = ch20 (Azure)

**Asia-Pacific:**
‚Ä¢ Singapore = ap10 (AWS)
‚Ä¢ Japan = jp10 (AWS)
‚Ä¢ Australia = ap11 (AWS)
‚Ä¢ South Korea = ap12 (AWS)

**URL Pattern:**
{region}.hana.ondemand.com

**Examples:**
‚Ä¢ https://eu10.hana.ondemand.com
‚Ä¢ https://us10.hana.ondemand.com
‚Ä¢ https://ap10.hana.ondemand.com

**Cloud Foundry API Pattern:**
https://api.cf.{region}.hana.ondemand.com
notes.title: BTP Region Mapping

notes.content:
Append these to any OData URL for quick debugging:

**/$metadata**
‚Üí Shows service structure (entities, properties)
‚Üí Check if service is healthy
‚Üí Example: https://api.sapsf.com/odata/v2/User/$metadata

**/?$format=json**
‚Üí View data in JSON format
‚Üí Easier to read than XML
‚Üí Example: https://api.sapsf.com/odata/v2/User?$format=json

**/?$top=1**
‚Üí Fetch just 1 record (performance test)
‚Üí Example: https://api.sapsf.com/odata/v2/User?$top=1

**/?$filter=Status eq 'Active'**
‚Üí Test filtering logic
‚Üí Example: https://api.sapsf.com/odata/v2/User?$filter=status eq 'active'

**/?$select=userId,username**
‚Üí Return only specific fields
‚Üí Example: https://api.sapsf.com/odata/v2/User?$select=userId,username

**Combine Parameters:**
https://api.sapsf.com/odata/v2/User?$format=json&$top=5&$select=userId,username

**Pro Tip:** Always use $format=json for readability
notes.title: OData Service Quick Checks

notes.content:
Essential Cloud Foundry CLI commands:

**Login & Target:**
cf login -a https://api.cf.{region}.hana.ondemand.com
cf target -o {org} -s {space}

**App Management:**
cf apps (list all apps)
cf app {app-name} (show app details)
cf logs {app-name} --recent (view logs)
cf env {app-name} (check environment variables)

**App Operations:**
cf restart {app-name}
cf restage {app-name} (rebuild with new buildpack)
cf scale {app-name} -i 2 (scale to 2 instances)
cf scale {app-name} -m 512M (increase memory)

**Deployment:**
cf push {app-name}
cf stop {app-name}
cf start {app-name}

**Services:**
cf services (list bound services)
cf service {service-name} (show service details)
cf bind-service {app-name} {service-name}

**Troubleshooting:**
cf events {app-name} (view crash logs)
cf ssh {app-name} (SSH into container)

**Pro Tip:** Use cf CLI v8+ for faster performance
notes.title: Cloud Foundry CLI Essentials
